intro: Braya brevicaulis, commonly known as the short-stemmed rock白菜, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant has compact, succulent-like leaves that help it retain moisture in dry environments. Its flowers are typically white or pale purple and bloom in early spring. Braya brevicaulis is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
